newsitem.title: UK: UK Labour affirms 10 pct long-term income tax goal.
newsitem.headline: UK Labour affirms 10 pct long-term income tax goal.

text.p: Britain's opposition Labour party reaffirmed that its long-term goal was to reduce the starting rate of income tax to 15 or 10 percent from the present 20 percent.

"It is our long-term objective to have a new lower starting rate of tax of fifteen pence, or preferably 10 pence in the pound, in contrast to the Conservatives' objective of abolishing capital gains tax and inheritance tax," Shadow Chancellor Gordon Brown told a business conference.
Labour wanted to create a tax and benefit system which maximised opportunity and rewarded hard work and effort.

Brown said Labour's goals in government would be improved skills for the workforce, encouragement for investment, support for small businesses, a modernised infrastructure and a positive approach to Europe.
